data.title: Facebook, Google, Twitter CEOs may be subpoenaed to testify before Senate
data.text: A hearing will address the legal liability protections under Section 230 that shield tech companies from lawsuits for content that users post.

data.title: Senate panel wants CEOs of Facebook, Google, Twitter to testify Oct. 1: report
data.text: The Republican-led Senate Commerce Committee plans to subpoena the CEOs of Facebook, Alphabet's Google and Twitter to testify at an Oct. 1 hearing

data.title: Senate panel plans to issue subpoenas to CEO's of Google, Facebook, Twitter
data.text: U.S. Senate Commerce Committee chaired by Republican Senator Roger Wicker plans to issue subpoenas to the chief executives of Twitter, Alphabet's Google and Facebook to testify at a hearing on Oct. 1.

data.title: Twitter (TWTR) Surges: Stock Moves 6.1% Higher
data.text: Twitter (TWTR) saw a big move last session, as its shares jumped more than 6% on the day, amid huge volumes.

data.title: What DOJ's proposal to curb Big Tech legal protections means for valuations
data.text: The battle between the Justice Department and Big Tech continues to heat up. The DOJ has submitted a proposal to Congress looking to curb legal protections for what is posted on the sites of tech companies.

data.title: Thailand takes first legal action against Facebook, Twitter over content
data.text: Thailand began legal action on Thursday against Facebook and Twitter for ignoring requests to take down content, in its first such move against major internet firms.
